body:
Applied Materials, Inc. (AMAT) ended last trading session with a change of -2 percent. It trades at an average volume of 10.34M shares versus 11.18M shares recorded at the end of last trading session. The share price of $34.34 is at a distance of 126.09 percent from its 52-week low and down -2.3 percent versus its peak. The company has a market cap of $36.97B and currently has 1.08B shares outstanding. The share price is currently 3.2 percent versus its SMA20, 5.8 percent versus its SMA50, and 24.82 percent versus its SMA200. The stock has a weekly performance of 1.75 percent and is 6.41 percent year-to-date as of the recent close.

On Dec. 01, 2016 Applied Materials, Inc. (AMAT) announced that its Board of Directors has approved a quarterly cash dividend of $0.10 per share payable on the company’s common stock. The dividend is payable on March 15, 2017 to shareholders of record as of February 22, 2017.

Applied Materials, Inc. (AMAT) is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality.

Oracle Corporation (ORCL) recently recorded 0 percent change and currently at $40.23 is 18.49 percent away from its 52-week low and down -3.26 percent versus its peak. It has a past 5-day performance of 1.39 percent and trades at an average volume of 13.1M shares. The stock has a 1-month performance of 4.41 percent and is 5.04 percent year-to-date as of the recent close. There were about 4.1B shares outstanding which made its market cap $165.04B. The share price is currently 2.61 percent versus its SMA20, 2.07 percent versus its SMA50, and 1.68 percent versus its SMA200.

On Jan. 24, 2017 Oracle Corporation (ORCL) announced the expansion of its Startup Cloud Accelerator program. The initiative will continue to fuel cloud-enabled innovation around the globe by opening new centers in Bristol, Delhi–NCR, Mumbai, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore and Tel Aviv.

Run by members of the Oracle research and development team, the program provides six months of mentoring from technical and business experts, state-of-the-art technology, a co-working space, access to Oracle customers, partners and investors, and free Oracle Cloud credits. It also offers an ever-expanding global network of startup peers.
title: Tech stocks for your portfolio: Applied Materials, Inc. (AMAT), Oracle Corporation (ORCL) | The Independent Republic
